turn.speaker: john_c_donham
turn.label: Mr. John C. Donham
turn.text: Well, if he's dangerous...

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: because --

turn.speaker: stephen_g_breyer
turn.label: Justice Stephen G. Breyer
turn.text: he's dangerous because he's autistic or has no sense whatsoever of what a feeling is.

turn.speaker: john_c_donham
turn.label: Mr. John C. Donham
turn.text: I would- I would say that he's an appropriate candidate for an involuntary commitment...

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: Right. And so, what standard there do we use?

turn.speaker: john_c_donham
turn.label: Mr. John C. Donham
turn.text: That he would be...

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: unable...

turn.speaker: stephen_g_breyer
turn.label: Justice Stephen G. Breyer
turn.text: do it with control because control has to do with volition.

turn.speaker: john_c_donham
turn.label: Mr. John C. Donham
turn.text: This would be a person susceptible to commitment because he's unable to care for himself, and therefore poses...

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: a danger for --

turn.speaker: stephen_g_breyer
turn.label: Justice Stephen G. Breyer
turn.text: perfectly.

turn.speaker: unknown_speaker
turn.label: Unknown Speaker
turn.text: [Inaudible]

turn.speaker: john_c_donham
turn.label: Mr. John C. Donham
turn.text: Yes, it is.

turn.speaker: william_h_rehnquist
turn.label: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist
turn.text: Thank you, Mr. Donham.
